page.title: 03TYPICAL NORFOLK FARM
page.content: Typical Norfolk farms are mainly arable,e.g they have wheat,barley, sugar beet,potatoes & peas.Sometimes some animals.They normally don't have sheep mainly cows & pigs. The type of soil is sandy.The average size of a farm is 77 hectares,.the average number of employees are 1.4. Buildings are normally thatched especially the storage barns Machinery used includes Tractors, Combines & Bailers.A Typical Norfolk Farmers Year:January:Grade potatoes, see to cattle.Febuary:Drill Barley,top dress corn March:Seed potatoes,drill potatoes,drill peas,drill sugar beet. April:Spray crops.June:Harvest peas. July:Spray crops for aphids.August: Harvest wheat.September:Finish Harvest clear land for winter.October:Havest potatoes.November:Havest sugar beet, plant winter wheat.Dec:plough fields.
